intro: Agalinis paupercula, commonly known as the poorflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Agalinis paupercula is often found in disturbed areas and is considered a short-lived perennial.
